page.title: 02LEWIS BURN : CONSERVATION
page.content: The{Lewis Burn}flows into the Kielder Reservoir just beyond the bounds of this "D-Block". The Burn has been designated as a conservation area, and as a nature reserve with a special purpose. {Otters}used to be a common sight in the area, but became quite rare. It is hoped to encourage the creatures to populate the banks of the Lewis Burn, and indeed they have now begun to make their homes in the area, and can occasionally be seen on the mud-banks at the Burns's edge. { A picnic-site}has been created for visitors. It may be used as the base for forest walks,or simply to enjoy the peace and quiet of the area.
